content: Hello World!
Hi Qian, mukesh here.
I am currently in Melbourne, and I think we met in DeepSpec summer school, Princeton.
Hi Mukesh! Sorry I missed the thread. Long time no see! :)
Hi
(Hi from Canberra!)
(not that Scott Morrison :-)
Hi Scott, You probably don't know me, but I know you. I was a PhD student at the Logic Group, ANU, Canberra and Dirk was my supervisor.

@Qian Hong (wechat: fracting) I am glad that finally you saw my message :)
@Joshua Moses Hi Joshua, nice to meet you.

Btw, there is a formal methods gathering, Formal Methods in Australia/New Zealand on 30 Sep - 1 Oct 2021 at The University of Queensland, St Lucia, https://wp.csiro.au/cdng/ (It's not updated yet, but hopefully, once it is finalise I will update here).
@Mukesh Tiwari cool, that's just in a few months, sounds exciting!
Hello! Recently graduated student from USYD here, hoping to get into Lean over the summer
I’m on the Central Coast north of Sydney and looking forward to using Lean 4 for self-study of maths concepts.
Even aside from mathlib Lean looks very interesting as a general FP language too.
I'm in Sydney for a few days now...

Hi, I'm a programming languages / formal methods researcher based in Sydney. Recently started looking into Lean for developing a security story for an operating system design. I'm keen to connect with any locals hacking in / on Lean.
Hello from between Sydney and Canberra :wave:
Hi @Jeremy Lindsay! I'm down in Canberra.
2 messages were moved here from #Geographic locality > Sydney, Australia by Patrick Massot.
@Jeremy Lindsay Note I moved your message because there are two threads about Sydney and this makes it harder for Sydney people to meet each other.
Also don’t hesitate to add yourself to the map on https://leanprover-community.github.io/meet.html
How to do that is explained below the map.
Added! :smiley:
Hi all! I am a postdoc at University of Sydney, I use Lean a fair bit in my research. Nice to meet all of you! :)
